TypeSignature.Value: public delegate uint AudioQueueProcessingTapDelegate(AudioQueueProcessingTap audioQueueTap, uint numberOfFrames, ref AudioTimeStamp timeStamp, ref AudioQueueProcessingTapFlags flags, AudioBuffers data);
.class public auto ansi sealed AudioQueueProcessingTapDelegate extends System.MulticastDelegate

Docs.param: Context for the callback, provides access to resources that the Tap can use and parameters of the Tap configuration.
Number of frames that the method should render.
For input queues, return the timestamp, for output queues, the current timestamp.
Siphoning taps can inspect the contents of the individual AudioBuffers in place but must not make changes to it. Other taps should allocate and fill the buffers as needed.
Docs.summary: Signature for AudioQueue's Tap callback handlers.
Docs.returns: Number of frames provided in data.

remarks.para: Call GetSourceAudio until the desired number of audio frames required by the tap to work is received.
Output taps should output the specified number of samples frames.
If the tap allocates AudioBuffers in data, it should keep those buffers valid until the next time the Tap callback is invoked.
